title: Chelsea forward Christian Pulisic won’t let Frank Lampard snub affect him
text:
Pulisic has struggled to get into Lampard’s good books at Chelsea (Picture: Rex Features)

Christian Pulisic insists he is not letting his lack of game time at Chelsea affect him ahead of the USA’s CONCACAF Nations League clash with Cuba.

Frank Lampard has continually snubbed Pulisic this season, but did hand the American his first minutes in the Premier League for over a month in the 4-1 win over Southampton last weekend.

Pulisic has been warned by his manager he needs to work harder to get into the starting eleven, but the 21-year-old brushed off questions about his position at Chelsea while on international duty.

‘I feel the best I ever have. I feel very confident in my game. I’m not going to let any of that affect me,’ Pulisic said on Wednesday.

Pulisic did not play in the league for Chelsea in September (Picture: Reuters)

‘I feel very strong, and I’m really looking forward to this game (on) Friday.

Advertisement

Advertisement

He added: ‘I’m here now to be focused with the US national team, so that’s really all that’s on my mind right now.’

Lampard was pleased with Pulisic’s cameo against Southampton and insisted the attacker would get further opportunities to impress during a busy winter period of fixtures.

Pulisic had been left out completely from Chelsea’s previous three matchday squads in the league and admitted earlier this week the repeated snubs ‘hurt’ him.

Lampard wants more effort from Pulisic (Picture: Getty)

He said: ‘Of course, you want to play, be on the field and be in the team as much as you can, and it hurts not to be there, but I’m happy I got my opportunity.

‘Competition in the team can only make me better and I think that’s what makes teams, it’s guys who are maybe not the second or third man, but they are pushing each other in training every single day. That’s what a good team is all about.

‘[Lampard] likes players who work very hard and show a lot in training and I just have to continue to do that, do my best in training and try to earn my position.’
